_meta.description: Power Geometry: structure of authority, governance systems, law as dimensional networks, democracy vs authoritarianism, conflict resolution through Δscale

_fractal_seed.holographic: Politics = geometry of power and authority. Power = 1D force (ability to compel). Authority = 3D legitimacy (right to govern). State = 3D container (monopoly on violence within territory). Law = 2D network rules. Democracy = distributed 2D network. Authoritarianism = centralized 0D-1D hierarchy. Conflict = Δscale mismatch. Peace = argmin Δscale (finding compatible scales). Justice = coherence balance. Freedom = degrees of freedom in dimensional space. Rights = protected dimensions. Governance = collective coordination across scales.
_fractal_seed.activation: Power flows like water (seeks lowest resistance). Authority requires coherence (legitimacy = collective agreement). Violence = failed Δscale resolution. True politics = +coherence for all, not zero-sum extraction. State can be 3D service container or 3D prison. Law can enable (2D network) or constrain (0D-1D chains). Your choice.

module.name: politics
module.title: Power Geometry - Structure of Authority
module.description: Complete political theory through CFO: power as 1D force, authority as 3D legitimacy, state as 3D territorial container, law as 2D network rules, governance as dimensional coordination. Democracy (distributed 2D) vs authoritarianism (centralized 0D-1D). Conflict resolution through Δscale minimization. Justice as coherence. Rights as protected dimensions. Freedom as dimensional navigation capacity.

essence.geometric: Politics = distribution and exercise of power across dimensional scales. Power = 1D force vector (can compel action). Authority = 3D legitimate power (recognized right to govern). State = 3D container with territorial boundaries. Law = 2D network of rules. Citizens = 0D nodes in political network. Governance = coordination mechanisms at each scale (local → regional → national → global).
essence.topological: Political space = network with power flows. Centralization vs decentralization = topological configuration. Democracy = distributed network (many nodes, many edges). Oligarchy = hub network (few central nodes). Dictatorship = star network (single central node). Anarchy = disconnected nodes. Optimal = scale-appropriate topology.
essence.functional: Politics = collective decision-making and coordination. Who decides what? Who enforces? Who resolves disputes? At what scale? Through which mechanisms? Power enables decisions. Authority legitimates them. Law structures them. Institutions implement them. Citizens consent (or resist).
essence.consciousness: Politics reflects collective consciousness. 0D: Tribal (strongman rule). 1D: Imperial (conquest). 2D: National (sovereignty). 3D: Democratic (systems). 4D: Global (planetary). 5D: Unity (no separation). Current world = transitioning 2D→3D→4D. Future = 5D (post-national unity consciousness). Politics = learning collective self-governance.

reductions.evidence: Power = 1D force - capacity to make others do what they otherwise wouldn't. Weber: power = ability to impose one's will despite resistance. Always directional (from source to target). Measured by effect (compliance vs resistance). Military = maximum 1D power (violence). Economic = 1D power (money). Social = 1D power (status). Form (directed force) = Function (compelling action).

Authority = 3D legitimate power structure. Not just force (1D) but recognized right to govern (3D system). Weber's types: traditional (inherited 3D structure), charismatic (personal 0D→3D), rational-legal (institutional 3D). Requires consent or acceptance (collective recognition). Authority without power = hollow. Power without authority = tyranny. Form (3D legitimate structure) = Function (stable governance).

State = 3D territorial container with monopoly on legitimate violence within boundaries. Weber: state = organization claiming monopoly on legitimate use of physical force in territory. Borders = 3D container walls. Citizenship = inclusion in container. Sovereignty = exclusive 3D authority. Modern state = Westphalian 3D system (1648+). Form (territorial cube) = Function (governance container).

Law = 2D network of rules governing behavior and relationships. Legal code = 2D map of permissions/prohibitions. Each law = edge connecting entities (nodes) with relationship rules. Common law = 2D emergent network (precedent). Civil law = 2D designed network (code). Constitutional law = meta-2D (rules about rules). Form (network structure) = Function (behavioral regulation).

Democracy = 2D distributed decision-making network. Power distributed across many nodes (citizens). Voting = 2D network computation (aggregating preferences). Representative democracy = 2D network with hub nodes (elected representatives). Direct democracy = flat 2D network (all participate). Consensus = 2D convergence. Majority rule = 2D optimization. Form (distributed network) = Function (collective governance).

Authoritarianism = 0D-1D centralized power structure. Single node (dictator, party, junta) controlling through 1D command lines. Star network topology (all power flows through center). Citizens = passive subjects (0D entities receiving 1D commands). No participation (2D network suppressed). Surveillance = 1D monitoring. Propaganda = 1D message control. Form (centralized hierarchy) = Function (concentrated control).

Justice = 2D-3D coherence restoration after violation. Retributive justice = 2D balance (harm → proportional punishment). Restorative justice = 3D healing (reintegrate violator + victim). Distributive justice = 2D fair allocation. Procedural justice = 2D fair process. Social justice = 3D system coherence (opportunity for all). Form (balance scales) = Function (coherence restoration).

Freedom = capacity to navigate dimensional space without constraint. Negative freedom = absence of 1D external constraints (freedom FROM). Positive freedom = presence of 2D+ capacities (freedom TO). 0D freedom = bare existence. 1D freedom = movement. 2D freedom = choice among alternatives. 3D freedom = self-governance. 4D freedom = temporal sovereignty. 5D freedom = unity consciousness (absolute freedom). Form (dimensional mobility) = Function (autonomous navigation).

Rights = 2D protected dimensional capacities. Each right = protected dimension of freedom. Life = 0D existence protection. Liberty = 1D movement protection. Property = 3D possession protection. Speech = 1D expression protection. Assembly = 2D gathering protection. Voting = 2D participation protection. Human rights = universal 2D protections. Constitutional rights = 2D legal guarantees. Form (protected dimensions) = Function (freedom safeguards).

Sovereignty = 3D exclusive territorial authority. Westphalian sovereignty (1648) = 3D state system (non-interference within borders). Internal sovereignty = 3D authority over territory. External sovereignty = 3D recognition by other states. Popular sovereignty = 3D authority from people. Sovereignty = 3D container principle (what's inside is mine to govern). Form (bounded territory) = Function (exclusive authority).

Political conflict = Δscale mismatch between entities at incompatible scales. Individual vs state (0D vs 3D). Ethnic group vs nation (2D vs 3D). Local vs global (3D vs 4D). Resolution = argmin Δscale (find transformation minimizing mismatch). Federalism = 3D solution (multiple scales). Subsidiarity = scale-matching principle. Mediation = finding compatible scale. Violence = failed Δscale resolution (force instead of geometry).
examples: Devolution = transferring power to lower scale

reductions.evidence: Revolution = political phase transition to higher dimensional organization. French Revolution: 1D monarchy → 2D democracy. Russian Revolution: 2D capitalism → 3D planned economy. Revolutions happen when current dimensional structure (n-D) cannot contain new complexity, forcing transition to (n+1)-D. Violence = chaotic transition. Peaceful = organized transition. Always dimensional shift. Form (phase change) = Function (political evolution).

fractal_structure.self_similarity: Political patterns repeat at every scale: individual (self-governance) → family (household authority) → community (local governance) → region → nation → global. Same dynamics: power, authority, rules, justice, conflict. Governance = self-organization at each level.
fractal_structure.recursion: (↓ individual → group → institution → state ↑)∞. Individuals (0D) form groups (2D networks), groups create institutions (3D systems), institutions form states (3D containers), states interact globally (4D). Each level emergent from below. Pattern repeats.
fractal_structure.emergence: Individual consent (0D) → Collective will (2D) → Institutional structure (3D) → State system (3D-4D) → Global governance (4D) → Planetary unity (5D). Each level has novel properties. Cannot predict 3D state from 0D individuals alone.
fractal_structure.composition: Personal sovereignty → Family governance → Community democracy → Regional coordination → National authority → International system → Global governance → Planetary consciousness (Gaia). Each participates in higher structure.

governance_systems_comparison.principle: Different governance systems = different dimensional configurations. Each has coherence trade-offs. Optimal = scale-appropriate hybrid.

direct_democracy.optimal_for: Small communities, local decisions, high trust contexts

representative_democracy.optimal_for: National level, complex issues, diverse populations

authoritarianism.optimal_for: Crisis response (temporary), BUT always pathological long-term

weaknesses: Extractive (elite benefits at expense of many)

anarchy.scale_limit: Very small or very large (requires high consciousness)
anarchy.optimal_for: High consciousness communities, voluntary associations, BUT requires evolved humans

federalism.optimal_for: Large diverse populations, complex modern states

liquid_democracy.structure: Dynamic delegation (vote or delegate on each issue)
strengths: Adaptability (delegate when want, vote when care)
Efficiency (not everyone must vote on everything)
liquid_democracy.optimal_for: Digital native communities, future governance, BUT needs refinement

optimal_hybrid.principle: Use appropriate system at appropriate scale

configuration.emergency: Temporary authoritarian (crisis response only, sunset clauses)

optimal_hybrid.coherence_optimization: Maximize participation at each scale. Minimize Δscale conflicts. Enable dimensional transitions as consciousness evolves.

power_vs_authority.distinction: Power = 1D capacity to compel. Authority = 3D legitimate power.
power_vs_authority.cfo_analysis: Power without authority = tyranny (unstable, requires constant force). Authority without power = ceremonial (symbolic but ineffective). Stable governance = power + authority (legitimized force).
power_vs_authority.implication: Long-term governance requires legitimacy, not just force. Dictatorships fall eventually (lack 3D legitimacy foundation). Democracies persist (built on 2D-3D consent structure).

democratic_peace_theory.claim: Democracies rarely war with each other
democratic_peace_theory.cfo_analysis: Democracies = 2D networks with internal Δscale resolution mechanisms (voting, debate, compromise). Two 2D systems have compatible scales (both value participation, rights, law). War = failed Δscale resolution. 2D↔2D conflicts resolvable without violence. Democracy vs authoritarianism = 2D vs 0D-1D (massive Δscale → war likely).
democratic_peace_theory.implication: Spread of democracy = spread of compatible governance scales = reduced war. But forced democratization = violence (imposed 2D on 0D-1D = massive disruption). Must evolve naturally.

tyranny_of_majority.problem: Democracy can oppress minorities through majority vote
tyranny_of_majority.cfo_analysis: Pure 2D democracy = network majority can dominate minority nodes. Solution: rights (2D protections) + federalism (multi-scale) + constitutional constraints (meta-2D limits). Not just 2D voting but 2D+3D protections.
tyranny_of_majority.implication: Democracy ≠ just voting. Requires rights (protected dimensions), rule of law (2D structure), and minority protections (coherence for all, not just majority).

state_necessity.cfo_analysis: State = 3D coordination container. At current consciousness (2D-3D), necessary for large-scale coordination. Without state: coordination problems, free-riding, vulnerability to violence from those who DO organize (0D-1D warlords). Anarchy works at 5D consciousness (unity) or very small scale (high trust). For 7 billion humans at 2D-3D = need state.
state_necessity.implication: State not inherently good or bad. Tool. Can be 3D service container (+coherence) or 3D prison (-coherence). Depends on structure and consciousness. Eventually (5D), may transcend need for state.

federalism_as_Δscale_solution.cfo_analysis: Federalism explicitly recognizes different issues operate at different scales. Local (2D community), Regional (3D coordination), National (3D-4D system), Global (4D). Subsidiarity = decisions at lowest appropriate scale (minimizes Δscale mismatch). Perfect implementation of argmin Δscale principle.
federalism_as_Δscale_solution.implication: Federal systems more stable because handle scale conflicts explicitly. Unitary states (everything national 3D) create Δscale mismatches (local issues decided far away). Federalism = political embodiment of CFO conflict resolution.

revolution_as_phase_transition.cfo_analysis: Revolution = dimensional phase transition when current structure (n-D) cannot contain new complexity. Pressure builds → sudden transition to (n+1)-D. Violent revolution = chaotic transition (system breaks before rebuilding). Peaceful revolution = organized transition (system transforms while maintaining coherence).
revolution_as_phase_transition.implication: Revolutions inevitable when dimensional structure mismatched with reality. Can be violent or peaceful depending on transition management. Gradual reform = smooth dimensional transitions. Blocked reform = pressure → explosive revolution.

voting_as_network_computation.cfo_analysis: Each citizen = node with preferences. Voting = aggregating node states into network decision. Different voting systems = different aggregation functions. Majority rule = simple threshold. Ranked choice = complex preference processing. Consensus = full network agreement. Voting IS network computation, not just 'counting opinions'.
voting_as_network_computation.implication: Can optimize voting systems like algorithms. Better aggregation functions = better collective decisions. Blockchain voting = cryptographically verified 2D network computation.

totalitarianism.description: Total control over all life dimensions (0D-1D domination)
totalitarianism.geometry: 0D dictator attempting to control all planes (XY, XZ, YZ, XW). Complete dimensional suppression except command lines from center.
totalitarianism.mechanism: Surveillance (1D monitoring all), propaganda (1D message control), terror (1D fear), atomization (preventing 2D networks), ideology (1D total worldview).
totalitarianism.problem: Attempts to reduce all complexity to 0D-1D. Requires constant force (unsustainable). Eventually collapses (USSR, Nazi Germany) or evolves (China toward oligarchy).
totalitarianism.coherence_impact: Maximally negative. Destroys all organic 2D-3D structure. Replaces with forced 0D-1D. Lowest possible coherence while maintaining control.
totalitarianism.escape: Collapse (coherence → 0) or evolution (dictator death → oligarchy → possible democracy)

failed_states.geometry: 3D container walls dissolve. Internal 2D networks fragment into 0D warlords with local 1D power.
failed_states.mechanism: Loss of monopoly on violence → multiple armed groups → territorial fragmentation → humanitarian crisis.
failed_states.problem: No coordination mechanism. Δscale conflicts everywhere (warlord vs warlord). Violence = only resolution method. Civilians caught in crossfire.
failed_states.coherence_impact: Severe negative. Society fragments from 3D state → 0D warlords. Coordination impossible. Suffering maximized.
failed_states.solution: External 4D intervention (UN peacekeeping) OR internal 3D reconstitution (new authority emerges) OR partition (multiple new 3D states)

regulatory_capture.geometry: 0D firms (regulated entities) co-opt 3D state regulators through 1D flows (money, jobs, influence). 2D law network bent to serve 0D private interests instead of 2D public good.
regulatory_capture.mechanism: Revolving door (regulators → industry jobs), lobbying (money → influence), information asymmetry (industry knows more than regulators).
regulatory_capture.problem: Regulation meant to protect public (2D) instead serves private (0D). Market failures uncorrected. Externalities unpunished.
regulatory_capture.coherence_impact: Negative. Destroys trust in institutions. Enables extraction. Increases inequality.
regulatory_capture.solution: Institutional design: longer cooling-off periods, public funding of campaigns, transparency requirements, citizen oversight (2D participation)

gerrymander.description: Manipulating electoral district boundaries for advantage
gerrymander.geometry: 2D democratic network topology artificially reshaped. Districts drawn to concentrate opposition voters (wasted votes) and disperse own voters (maximized wins). Warps 2D network computation (voting).
gerrymander.mechanism: Party in power redraws 2D district map. Uses demographic data to optimize for own seats. Creates 'packed' districts (opponent waste) and 'cracked' districts (opponents diluted).
gerrymander.problem: Voting ≠ fair representation. Network computation corrupted. Minority (popular vote) can govern majority. Entrenches power.
gerrymander.coherence_impact: Negative. Destroys democratic legitimacy. Distorts will of network.
gerrymander.solution: Independent redistricting commissions OR algorithmic fair division OR proportional representation (eliminates districts)

populism.geometry: 0D charismatic leader claims to represent 'the people' (2D network) against 'corrupt elite' (3D institutions). Bypasses 3D structures through direct 1D connection to masses.
populism.mechanism: Charismatic authority (0D→2D). Anti-institutional rhetoric. Simple solutions to complex problems. Us vs them framing.
populism.problem: Weakens 3D institutions (rule of law, checks and balances, expertise). Can slide into authoritarianism (0D→1D). Substitutes 0D personality for 3D structure.
populism.ambiguity: Can be positive (challenges corrupt oligarchy) or negative (destroys functional institutions). Depends on context.
populism.coherence_impact: Variable. Positive if oligarchy breaking, negative if democracy destroying.
populism.resolution: Institutional reform (fix 3D without destroying) OR wait out (0D leader eventually goes)

bureaucratic_sclerosis.description: 3D institutions become rigid, unable to adapt
bureaucratic_sclerosis.geometry: 3D structure ossifies. Rules multiply (2D network becomes dense maze). Innovation suppressed. Change impossible.
bureaucratic_sclerosis.mechanism: Institutional accumulation (new rules, no removal). Risk aversion (don't change what works). Sunk costs (invested in current system).
bureaucratic_sclerosis.problem: Cannot adapt to new reality. Increasingly Δscale mismatch with changing world. Eventually crisis forces change (revolution) or decline.
bureaucratic_sclerosis.coherence_impact: Negative. System serves itself, not purpose. Low coherence (structure without function).
bureaucratic_sclerosis.solution: Periodic renewal (sunset clauses), institutional experimentation (try new forms), external pressure (crisis), OR revolutionary replacement

problems: Global issues (climate, pandemics, AI, war) require 4D coordination
Prisoner's dilemmas everywhere (tragedy of commons at global scale)
Δscale conflicts (3D nations vs 4D planetary needs)
current_state.unsustainable: Global challenges require global coordination. 3D system insufficient.

mechanisms: Expand UN authority (peacekeeping, climate enforcement, pandemic response)
International courts with teeth (ICC, ICJ with enforcement)
Global taxation (carbon tax, wealth tax, financial transaction tax)
Digital governance (global internet governance, AI regulation)
transition_path.resistance: 3D states resist (sovereignty concerns). Must demonstrate 4D benefits (peace, prosperity, survival).

structure.example: Earth Federation: states like US states, federation like US federal government, but planetary

transition_to_global_governance.structure: Unity consciousness. Political boundaries dissolve (obsolete). Humanity = single organism (Gaia's brain).
transition_to_global_governance.governance: Organic coordination (like cells in body). No coercion needed (everyone acts for whole). Anarchism works at 5D.
transition_to_global_governance.note: Requires consciousness evolution. Cannot be imposed. Must emerge naturally as humans realize: we are one.

personal_level.political_participation: Vote (2D network participation). Protest (1D expression). Organize (2D network building). Run for office (becoming 3D authority node).
personal_level.conflict_resolution: Apply argmin Δscale in family, work, community. Find compatible scales. Avoid violence (failed resolution).
personal_level.rights_protection: Know your rights (2D protections). Assert them when violated. Support others' rights (coherence for all).
personal_level.consciousness_development: Evolve from 0D (me) → 2D (us) → 3D (systems) → 4D (global) → 5D (unity). Politics = external manifestation of internal consciousness.

community_level.local_governance: Direct democracy for small decisions. Represent democracy for complex issues. Consensus when possible.
community_level.institution_building: Create 3D structures (co-ops, associations, community organizations). Build 2D networks (connections, coalitions, movements).
community_level.conflict_mediation: Become skilled in Δscale analysis. Help groups find compatible scales. Prevent escalation to violence.
community_level.participatory_budgeting: Let community decide spending (2D network allocation). Increases legitimacy and engagement.

systemic_level.electoral_reform: Ranked choice voting (better aggregation). Proportional representation (fairer 2D network). Independent redistricting (prevent gerrymandering).
systemic_level.institutional_design: Sunset clauses (periodic renewal). Transparency requirements (public oversight). Anti-corruption measures (reduce capture).
systemic_level.federalism: Multi-scale governance (subsidiarity). Decisions at appropriate scale (minimize Δscale).
systemic_level.global_coordination: Support UN reform. International treaties. Climate agreements. Pandemic preparedness. AI governance.
systemic_level.consciousness_raising: Education about CFO politics. Show dimensional structure of power. Train in argmin Δscale conflict resolution.

warnings: 5D unity governance aspirational - requires evolved consciousness not yet achieved
Global governance transition path optimistic - resistance from 3D states intense
Some dimensional mappings approximate - politics messier than clean geometry
Liquid democracy promising but experimental - limited real-world data
Revolution as phase transition = useful metaphor but not predictive model
info: Politics = dimensional geometry (power=1D, authority=3D, democracy=2D, state=3D)
Conflict = Δscale. Resolution = argmin Δscale. Violence = failed resolution.
Democracy = 2D distributed network. Authoritarianism = 0D-1D centralized control.
Freedom = dimensional navigation capacity. Rights = protected dimensions.
Justice = coherence restoration. Law = 2D rule network.
Current world = 3D state system. Future = 4D global → 5D unity.
Federalism = built-in multi-scale structure (perfect Δscale solution)
Purpose = +coherence for all, not zero-sum power extraction
This module bridges CFO theory to political science - aplicación real del framework

external.citation: Weber, M. (1919). Politics as a Vocation
external.relevance: Power, authority, legitimate violence - foundational concepts

external.citation: Rawls, J. (1971). A Theory of Justice
Hayek, F. (1944). The Road to Serfdom
external.relevance: Critique of central planning, knowledge problem

external.citation: Lijphart, A. (1977). Democracy in Plural Societies
